TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
[@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) I see my Advanced Pilot Precision Award x5 and raise myself Advanced Pilot Precision Award x8.

In <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr>, first lap

Spoiler

![PlPpYEs.png](https://i.imgur.com/PlPpYEs.png)

Craft in <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr>. This is about the most mass per Rapier engine that can safely take off from the runway, and I don't like flats takeoffs. I got a similar payload fraction adding another pair of wing strakes to increase lift but that's also extra mass.

![NKq0obP.png](https://i.imgur.com/NKq0obP.png)

On runway

![A3uED1t.png](https://i.imgur.com/A3uED1t.png)

I accelerate at sea level until the wing incidence starts making me climb.

![TAwq77H.png](https://i.imgur.com/TAwq77H.png)

I turn on the nuclear engine at 1660-1680 m/s. This is high enough that the Rapier's higher specific impulse saves lots of delta-v but not so high that the Rapier's effective Isp drops below the Nerv.

![GhMPeth.png](https://i.imgur.com/GhMPeth.png)

In orbit

![4r5LTTx.png](https://i.imgur.com/4r5LTTx.png)

Aerobraking

![1sfi76g.png](https://i.imgur.com/1sfi76g.png)

Approach

![h4Qj0Wa.png](https://i.imgur.com/h4Qj0Wa.png)

First lap complete

Second through fourth laps

Spoiler

![tzDNjnS.png](https://i.imgur.com/tzDNjnS.png)

Ascent is easier because of less mass this time

![j93ZSNT.png](https://i.imgur.com/j93ZSNT.png)

I turn on the nuclear engine too late here so I lose too much delta-v to drag

![KSIye5W.png](https://i.imgur.com/KSIye5W.png)

In orbit

![Lu7Ypqi.png](https://i.imgur.com/Lu7Ypqi.png)

Lap 2 complete

![OrHOAGi.png](https://i.imgur.com/OrHOAGi.png)

Lap 3 ascent

![IyqJSm9.png](https://i.imgur.com/IyqJSm9.png)

Nuke turns on at 1680 m/s

![vS93L0e.png](https://i.imgur.com/vS93L0e.png)

In orbit

![OwL4Bzj.png](https://i.imgur.com/OwL4Bzj.png)

Approach

![e7wrc8x.png](https://i.imgur.com/e7wrc8x.png)

Lap 3 complete. I don't know what went wrong with the fuel gauge here but you can see I have lots of delta-v remaining

![gPgH6eY.png](https://i.imgur.com/gPgH6eY.png)

Ascent, nuke turns on at 1670 m/s

![9NRC5DL.png](https://i.imgur.com/9NRC5DL.png)

In orbit

![IlTNxnP.png](https://i.imgur.com/IlTNxnP.png)

Approach

![mWSJOLp.png](https://i.imgur.com/mWSJOLp.png)

Lap 4 complete

Laps 5-8

Spoiler

![Cy8dw9o.png](https://i.imgur.com/Cy8dw9o.png)

At this point the wing area on this craft starts to be a bit excessive. I end up climbing a bit too quickly to be fully efficient.

![bVaIDLP.png](https://i.imgur.com/bVaIDLP.png)

In orbit

![vqWLBu3.png](https://i.imgur.com/vqWLBu3.png)

Lap 5 complete

![Cls2R9o.png](https://i.imgur.com/Cls2R9o.png)

Nuke turns on at 1680 m/s as usual

![CeCPgbc.png](https://i.imgur.com/CeCPgbc.png)

In orbit

![zc9x1eL.png](https://i.imgur.com/zc9x1eL.png)

Lap 6 complete. I was initially only going for seven laps but at this point I realized I actually had enough fuel for an eighth.

![bNwxa7w.png](https://i.imgur.com/bNwxa7w.png)

I took as shallow of an ascent as I could here to save fuel for the last lap because the wing area was going to start really being excessive.

![bywiNJR.png](https://i.imgur.com/bywiNJR.png)

In orbit

![Mge4UVY.png](https://i.imgur.com/Mge4UVY.png)

Lap 7 complete.

![ANGMTtz.png](https://i.imgur.com/ANGMTtz.png)

Final ascent. At this point I can't climb efficiently anymore but I try my best

![https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/697644473244712983/833273745372217354/Screenshot_763.png](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/697644473244712983/833273745372217354/Screenshot_763.png)

In orbit - 53 m/s left

![https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/697644473244712983/833273750383230996/Screenshot_764.png](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/697644473244712983/833273750383230996/Screenshot_764.png)

Deorbiting - 13 m/s left!

![https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/697644473244712983/833273755610251274/Screenshot_765.png](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/697644473244712983/833273755610251274/Screenshot_765.png)

Final approach

![https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/697644473244712983/833273755701739540/Screenshot_766.png](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/697644473244712983/833273755701739540/Screenshot_766.png)

Eight orbits complete

I had 40-50 m/s of deorbit burn for each of my eight orbits for about 360 m/s wasted. I probably wasted another 200-250 m/s on orbital insertions. Maybe with a bit more fuel and better flight profiles I can fit in a ninth orbit but I probably won't attempt it.

Edit: Instead of "Untitled Space Craft" can you call it "Relay Race 2"

**Edited <time datetime="2021-04-18T09:48:48Z" title="04/18/2021 09:48  AM" data-short="3 yr">April 18, 2021</time> by camacju**

Overall experience with youtube and the forums recently indicates that part clipping is now a fully accepted strategy. 

Interesting. I'll just say that the kerbals have found a way to hyperdensify fuel. After all, their planets are ***REALLY*** dense.
The craft would probably work fine even without clipping of the fuel tanks. I only did that so I could have a lighter fairing

Congratulations [@camacju](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/207172-camacju/) on completing the K-Prize mission eight times over in one launch with a prodigious feat of endurance demonstrating true dedication to the cause of reusability!

APPA x8 it is, well flown, thanks for your mission report and welcome back to the K-Prize roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list.

![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

<iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="113" width="200" data-embed-src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zaZNbMxyZ_Y?feature=oembed"></iframe>

This should be 4 APPAs on 

SRSTO

Jack of No Trades

Mk2 <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> for Passengers

Silver Bullet

It liiives!

[@tosha](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/172147-tosha/)thanks for resurrecting the K-Prize.

Congratulations on completing the K-Prize challenge successfully four times with four craft designs and earning three highly regarded APPAs with SRSTO, Jack of No Trades & Mk2 <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit"><abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr></abbr> for Passengers and a sincerely respectable PPM for the Silver Bullet mission which I hope you agree did not touch the grey runway texture due to collision with the floodlight and came to rest, with zero <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> or any other motive means, on the sloping green bank around the runway which counts as <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> field ... so close.

Thanks for your video mission reports and welcome back to the K-Prize party guest list aka the roll of honour. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")  (I have added the mission kudos beneath your previous successful mission listings.)
Thanks! I concur on the silver bullet demotion to PPM. Stupid light

Rocket-only <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> craft are pretty fun. I think I did a rocket-only <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> to Eeloo once, but it was vertical takeoff. I wonder how far I can push a horizontal takeoff craft?

Here's my entry with a relatively simple design

![4IuN94F.jpg](https://imgur.com/4IuN94F.jpg)

2 RAPIERs and one NERVA engine. It has a probe core so it can be flown autonomously. Fuel tanks aren't filled up completely so you can balance the weight around if needed. And it also has a cargo bay, which is somewhat small but sizeable enough to fit, for example, this Minmus lander

![NU7OGK9.jpg](https://imgur.com/NU7OGK9.jpg)

![zE5EUf4.jpg](https://imgur.com/zE5EUf4.jpg)

Next set of pictures show the craft getting to orbit, deploying the payload and returning back to <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> autonomously, while the pilot in the lander continues all the way to Minmus and lands here. Pilot also returned back to Kerbin in the same lander successfully, but I forgot to take pictures ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")

Spoiler

![0SNK6Pm.jpg](https://imgur.com/0SNK6Pm.jpg)

![TOpHjb6.jpg](https://imgur.com/TOpHjb6.jpg)

![mDdsoyE.jpg](https://imgur.com/mDdsoyE.jpg)

![EomWJSf.jpg](https://imgur.com/EomWJSf.jpg)

![QRpqr9t.jpg](https://imgur.com/QRpqr9t.jpg)

![3ReMZJI.jpg](https://imgur.com/3ReMZJI.jpg)

[Here's the craft file if anyone is interested](https://file.io/aWQH94miqYnX)

Congratulations [@OJT](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/217353-ojt/) on successfully completing the K-Prize challenge mission with the effective Concorde <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, lifting a compact Minmus lander into Kerbin orbit and returning to land safely on the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway which earns the highly regarded kudos of an Advanced Pilot Precision Award along with the much sought after Utilitarial Commendation for the payload to orbit. Thankyou for your mission report and welcome to the K-Prize party guest list aka the roll of honour. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
In theory, if I flew an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">ssto</abbr>, landed, refueled it, reloaded it, and then flew it again, would I get a special rank for true reusability?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Staticalliam7 said:
> 
> 
> In theory, if I flew an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit"><abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">ssto</abbr></abbr>, landed, refueled it, reloaded it, and then flew it again, would I get a special rank for true reusability?
> 

You get a x2 or xn multiplier by the kudos, refuelling on Kerbin ends one mission and starts another but they are added together if it is the same craft. There have been precedents and I discussed it a bit after this post...

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedauthorid="118094" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed8482062523" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=embed&comment=3610257&embedComment=3610257&embedDo=findComment" style="height:297px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

> 
> 
> 13 hours ago, Staticalliam7 said:
> 
> 
> In theory, if I flew an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit"><abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">ssto</abbr></abbr>, landed, refueled it, reloaded it, and then flew it again, would I get a special rank for true reusability?
> 

~~Just don't refuel it. Do the missions in succession without refueling lol~~

I've got a design that should be able to do a Laythe mission, land back on Kerbin, then do a Mun mission, land on Kerbin, and then an Eeloo mission, before coming back to Kerbin, but I don't have the patience to fly it right now.

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, Staticalliam7 said:
> 
> 
> In theory, if I flew an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit"><abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">ssto</abbr></abbr>, landed, refueled it, reloaded it, and then flew it again, would I get a special rank for true reusability?
> 

Plus I forgot to mention that if you examine the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> you will see Dman Revolution was awarded a discretionary HyperCycle award for extraordinary services to reusability for x12  K-Prize mission flights with the same craft launch. So I would say that if you or anyone achieves the same or better then you will also earn a HyperCycle award, which is a very rare award since only one has ever been awarded to the best of my knowledge.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, camacju said:
> 
> 
> Just don't refuel it. Do the missions in succession without refueling lol
> 

I meant refuelling on kerbin, which to my knowledge is well within the rules

<iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="113" width="200" data-embed-src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/X9bgKYpi99w?feature=oembed"></iframe>

As far as I'm aware this is the lightest ever Moho <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>.

Previous record was 14.9 tons by N727.

Congratulations [@camacju](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/207172-camacju/)on completing the K-Prize mission with the diminutive 13.6 ton Moho <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit"><abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr></abbr>. If you have a name for that let me know and I will add it. Landing involved contact with the runway but the craft stopped on the green bank beside it, which by Kerbal standards is close enough to get to the <abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar"><abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr></abbr> snack bar and earns the well respected kudos of a Pilot Proficiency Medal.

Landing on Moho and returning to tell the tale of prodigious use of gravity assists to great grand nieces and nephews earns a laudable Astrokerbal Distinction (Moho). While there is no official kudos for ship size relating to a specific destination the commitee recognise it was a smaller ship than the last one which made it to Moho (which is a hard place to get to) and back and would like to say it was a commendable feat of distinction which must have required great patience and planning.

Thanks for your video mission report and welcome back to the K-Prize party guest list aka the roll of honour.

PS The K-Prize committee unanimously voted to award a discretionary  *Slingshot Supremo* for this mission for its use of multiple slingshots to reach its target  and make a landing on the innermost planet of the Kerbol system and return. Only one other *Slingshot Supremo* has been awarded, to dvader for a remarkable 2340 year Altitudinalist Record attempt, which seems an appropriate symmetry, for now.

**Edited <time datetime="2021-12-01T17:44:24Z" title="12/01/2021 05:44  PM" data-short="2 yr">December 1, 2021</time> by BuranAce**

If you thought the last <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> mission had a lot of gravity assists...

<iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="113" width="200" data-embed-src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XH3Geh7MeoY?feature=oembed"></iframe>

The 'Laythe Star' has enough range to go from Kerbin's surface, to Laythe's surface, and back to Kerbin ... three times in  a row without refueling.

To do so, however, requires many, many gravity assists.

Congratulations [@camacju](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/207172-camacju/) on completing the K-Prize mission with the prodigious use of slinghsot maneuvers to achieve three landings on Laythe and return to <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway from just one launch with a stylish interplanetary spaceship that looks like a star. For which the K-Prize commitee decided to make the uncommonly rare and prestigious discretionary *Stelicious* award, for spaceships shaped like a star![:rep:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/rep.png ":rep:") as well as a *Slingshot Supremo* award for using a dozen or more slingshots in a single mission. 

- Advanced Pilot Precision Award x3, Astrokerbal Distinction (Laythe) x3 with Laythe Star (video). (Discretionary Slingshot Supremo award.) (Discretionary Stelicious award.)

Thanks for your video mission report and welcome back to the K-Prize party guest list aka the roll of honour.

As a newish player I submit my first <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, *[Gazelle](https://kerbalx.com/NyetiArts/Gazelle-SSTO)*.  It's nothing exceptional, but it'll take a crew of three to <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>, dock, and fly back using two Whiplashes and a NERV.

(Link includes shots of orbital burn and docking.)

![cYpaIp1.png](https://i.imgur.com/cYpaIp1.png)

Hi [@NyetiArts](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/217909-nyetiarts/) thanks for posting your career <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> spaceplane Gazelle.

FYI if you would like to join the merry throng on the roll of honour aka K-Prize party guest list, then you need to share a report of an actual mission. Details are on page 1 of this thread. See para 1.
